page.title: 04The Old School, Llandygwydd
page.content: Llandygwydd village has forty houses it is a centre for the Young Farmers' Club from the surrounding area. It has a Women's Institute with twenty members and the Church has Mother's Union for women parishoners with thirty memers Llandygwydd had a school from 1854 to 1973. There are two buildings, one infants and one juniors In 1973 the building were condemned as too old and dangerous because of subsidence, and with inadequate facilities such as indoor toilets and playing area for the children. At the time of closure there were forty two chilren on the register. The Church has bought the buildings for Â£100 and it is now used as a Village Hall. The curch holds its business meetin, social events, such as Harest Suppers, Chirstmas parties and fund-raising activites in the hall.
